title: v2.28.1 - erigon is not syncing with prysm
body:
System information

Erigon version: v2.28.1 

OS & Version: Windows Server 2022

Expected behaviour

erigon is syncing with prysm

Actual behaviour

erigon is not syncing with prysm v3.1.1

**erigon**

logs:

INFO[10-17|17:23:25.146] [2/16 Headers] Handling new payload      height=15768692 hash=0x914c945e6ab9aaef948cf8a8d7325aaba999cd5f5208274078a881f231305c6f
INFO[10-17|17:23:27.448] Commit cycle                             in=2.2989481s
INFO[10-17|17:23:27.452] [2/16 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer...
INFO[10-17|17:23:36.542] [2/16 Headers] Handling new payload      height=15768693 hash=0xff10dbba41bfb5ade1313ba050ed45942726bfff455eae68bd3f976d9cfa5ca1
INFO[10-17|17:23:38.845] Commit cycle                             in=2.3010171s
INFO[10-17|17:23:38.848] [2/16 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer...
INFO[10-17|17:23:47.593] [2/16 Headers] Handling new payload      height=15768694 hash=0xbebef38c8fec438370bd8bf3bd759b8a350a9a8f43c892dff7a082cc50de698e
INFO[10-17|17:23:49.870] Commit cycle                             in=2.27603s
INFO[10-17|17:23:49.873] [2/16 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer...
INFO[10-17|17:24:00.872] [2/16 Headers] Handling new payload      height=15768695 hash=0x94d5ef41dadba85d9be802f0a31fcf0cba6962698a33a53f5c1c61ddfabd60a5
INFO[10-17|17:24:03.154] Commit cycle                             in=2.2800132s
INFO[10-17|17:24:03.159] [2/16 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer...
INFO[10-17|17:24:11.551] [2/16 Headers] Handling new payload      height=15768696 hash=0x6abf6bff89416cefad43096e6d9f652ffba7e2e4c0aff6730a984e3bdc00e380
INFO[10-17|17:24:13.823] Commit cycle                             in=2.2709152s
INFO[10-17|17:24:13.828] [2/16 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer...
INFO[10-17|17:24:22.794] [txpool] stat                            block=15765689 pending=10000 baseFee=30000 queued=30000 alloc=2.5GB sys=3.2GB

-> txpool is very behind the headers height

configs:

chain : mainnet
port : 30303

datadir : D:\xx
ethash.dagdir : D:\xx

prune : htc
snapshots : true
torrent.download.rate : 20mb

http : true
ws : true 
private.api.addr : localhost:9090

authrpc.jwtsecret : D:xx
authrpc.port : 8551

**prysm**

logs:

[2022-10-17 17:29:48]  INFO blockchain: Called new payload with optimistic block payloadBlockHash=0x5d185a943bfe slot=4933047
[2022-10-17 17:29:48]  INFO blockchain: Called fork choice updated with optimistic block finalizedPayloadBlockHash=0xb9b2ef299133 headPayloadBlockHash=0x5d185a943bfe headSlot=4933047
[2022-10-17 17:29:48]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block block=0x0512a0fa... epoch=154157 finalizedEpoch=154155 finalizedRoot=0x69afa429... slot=4933047
[2022-10-17 17:29:48]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=70 payloadHash=0x5d185a943bfe slot=4933047 syncBitsCount=508 txCount=140
[2022-10-17 17:29:49]  INFO p2p: Peer summary activePeers=111 inbound=106 outbound=5
[2022-10-17 17:29:56]  WARN powchain: Execution client is not syncing

-> message erigon is not syncing

configs:

mainnet : true 
enable-only-blinded-beacon-blocks : false
accept-terms-of-use : true

datadir : D:\xx 

p2p-max-peers : 120
p2p-host-ip : xx

execution-endpoint : http://localhost:8551
jwt-secret : D:\xx
suggested-fee-recipient : xx

I need urgently help. Because my Validator is not active. :-(

Thank you so much.

Same here. Also getting these error from prysm: 

```
[2022-10-17 16:29:41]  WARN rpc/validator: Not connected to ETH1. Cannot determine validator ETH1 deposit block number
[2022-10-17 16:29:42] ERROR powchain: Unable to process past deposit contract logs, perhaps your execution client is not fully synced error=Could not process deposit log: received incorrect merkle index: wanted 409932 but got 453707
```

I suspect I went too aggressive on pruning. I'm running erigon with the following arguments: `--datadir=/path/to/foo --prune=htc --prune.r.before=11052984 --torrent.download.rate=100mb`

Thank you in advance for any suggestions!
Having the same issue as OP on Erigon 2.28.1 + Lighthouse
Also having the same issue, also running lighthouse
https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/5716 pretty sure this is the same thing, there are several related issues open on this now

Seems a `Fork choice: chain extension from=0 to=15796341` is a must for erigon to continue next stages, which is from beacon client

https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/blob/4795217e4e266a8a1b695bb741c51cbfba6489ff/eth/stagedsync/stage_headers.go#L175

```golang
interrupt, requestId, requestWithStatus := cfg.hd.BeaconRequestList.WaitForRequest(syncing, test)
request := requestWithStatus.Message
forkChoiceMessage, forkChoiceInsteadOfNewPayload := request.(*engineapi.ForkChoiceMessage)

	if forkChoiceInsteadOfNewPayload {
		payloadStatus, err = startHandlingForkChoice(forkChoiceMessage, requestStatus, requestId, s, u, ctx, tx, cfg, test, headerInserter, preProgress)
	} else {
		payloadMessage := request.(*types.Block)
		payloadStatus, err = handleNewPayload(payloadMessage, requestStatus, requestId, s, ctx, tx, cfg, test, headerInserter)
	}
```

As long as prysm do not send a  fork choice message, erigon will wait indefinitely...

For this matter there are many Issues but no solutions.
Erigon doesn't works for me and I lost money.
And now I use an another execution client and close this post.

@gufei Not knowing whether erigon developer is working on this or not...

I re-started from using snapshot provided by archivenode.io, and face the same problem `[ForkChoiceUpdated] stage loop is busy ` like https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/5821

So I just made a try to comment out these three lines

https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/blob/da354bc01a127d26e7c97737dc34806f7e327560/ethdb/privateapi/ethbackend.go#L485-L488

which successfully made erigon to start next stages (body, execution and so on...), but also made more errors, so I changed it back afterwards. I don't know whether this issue is solved by this code change, or just it needs time...

Currently, my erigon works fine (sometimes will lag minutes). I do not need erigon for real-time data usage (like eth staking or front-running), so some lagging is tolerable to me.

prysm v3.1.2
and using hetzner ax101
